questions.text: Who had to refer to Josh as Wild Thing?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Josh (to Donna): "Hey, what did I say about speaking to me without addressing me as 'Wild Thing'?"

questions.text: How many buttons did Jack Reese's trousers have on them?
questions.explanation:
13.

	Josh (to Donna): "I don't want to know how you know that."

questions.text: What magazine did Josh tell the President he could use to be sworn in with?
questions.explanation:
'Sports Illustrated'.

	Josh: "There's nothing saying you have to be sworn in on a Bible. You can be sworn in on a 'Sports Illustrated' Swimsuit Issue."

questions.text: Did Will break the window between his and Toby's office?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Josh (to Toby): "That's never happened before has it?"  Toby: "No, it hasn't."

questions.text: Who told Hutchinson about the Forced Depletion report?
questions.explanation:
Leo.

	No one was supposed to know, but Leo slipped up and Jack was deployed to the other side of the world because he was the one who wrote it.

questions.text: Who told the President that an American life meant more to him than a Kudenese life?
questions.explanation:
Will.

	Jed (to Will): "That was ballsy."

questions.text: Donna made the comment to the newspaper about the White House.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Jack Reese made the comment and Donna took the blame for it knowing Josh would figure out it wasn't her that made the comment. It took him a while longer to figure it out than Donna figured it would.

questions.text: Who thought Will should have a White House wake up call before he left Washington?
questions.explanation:
Josh and Toby.

	Will was staying at the Holiday Inn when he received a phone call. Six seconds later, his pager went off, his cell phone went off and six seconds after that the hotel manager started banging on the door.

questions.text: How many Inaugural balls did the President have to attend?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Donna: "Eight times the fun."

questions.text: President: "_______ are standing in front of tanks. We're going to go get their backs."
questions.explanation:
Mothers.

	He said this after he appointed Will the new Deputy Communications Director.

questions.text: What kind of noise did Josh hear when he was appointed Deputy Chief of Staff?
questions.explanation:
Buzzing or humming.

	Donna (to Josh): "That was a good story about the buzzing."

questions.text: What was the first number of casulties that CJ gave to the press?
questions.explanation:
15,000.

	The number kept increasing each time she had a press conference.

questions.text: CJ said she could have which person whenever she wanted?
questions.explanation:
Danny.

	Danny (to CJ): "Can I ask what exactly you would do to have me?

questions.text: Who said, "Here's to swimmin' with bow-legged women"?
questions.explanation:
Bartlet.

	President Bartlet gave the toast in the Oval Office with Leo.

questions.text: Who said they knew what women were like?
questions.explanation:
Josh.

	This was right before he pelted Donna's window with snowballs.

questions.text: Did Jed give the girls candy when they were kids?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Jed (to Abbey): "I was their dealer. Live with it."

questions.text: How many in Josh's group of guys played the bad cop to his good cop?
questions.explanation:
4.

	The group that went with Josh was Will, Toby, Danny, and a drunken Charlie.

questions.text: Who threw up while in the Capitol Building?
questions.explanation:
Will.

	Will (to Toby): "This is my third time."

questions.text: Which comedy group was the President watching in his study?
questions.explanation:
Laurel and Hardy.

	He told Abbey not to tell anyone the reason he sent troops into Kundu was based on a Laurel and Hardy movie.

questions.text: What nickname did the President call the 101st Airborne Division?
questions.explanation:
Screaming Eagles.

	The President also said that the M.E.U. from Camp Lejune was sent to Kundu.
